'''Calenhir''' was a river in [[Gondor]] that flowed east from the [[Pinnath Gelin]] into the [[Morthond]]. On the "working map" that [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] used while writing ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' the river was drawn on the map but only named in the list of the "Rivers of Gondor".<ref>{{WR|3|XIV}}, West, p. 434</ref> This river was removed from the maps of the published ''Lord of the Rings''<ref>{{FR|Map}}</ref> and the ''[[Unfinished Tales]]''.<ref>{{UT|Map}}</ref>

Its name seems to mean "Green River" in [[Sindarin]], from ''[[calen]]'' ("green") + [[Lenition|lenited]] ''[[sîr]]'' ("river").<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-1812900837.html|articlename=N. ''Calenhir'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=27 December 2020}}</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2014: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:Calenhir belongs to the region of [[Anfalas]], the in-game boundaries of [[Pinnath Gelin]] beginning just slightly north of its origin.
